name: Version 3.3.0
body:
New:
- Symbol search

Test:
> Test finished. Result: 7/7.

name: Version 3.2.10
body:
New:
- [Proxy support](https://python-tradingview-ta.readthedocs.io/en/latest/usage.html#proxy)
- `additional_indicators` for `get_multiple_analysis()`

name: Version 3.2.9
body:
New:
- Interval: 30 minutes (`INTERVAL_30_MINUTES`) and 2 hours (`INTERVAL_2_HOURS`)

name: Version 3.2.8
body:
New:

- Indicators: change, low, high

name: Version 3.2.7
body:
Fix:
- get_multiple_analysis() will now return `None` if there is no analysis for that symbol. See #55 for more details.

name: Version 3.2.6
body:
Fix:
- Add indicators
- Get multiple analysis

name: Version 3.2.5
body:
New:
- `TA_Handler.get_indicators()`: Retrieve indicators (without technical analysis).
- `TA_Handler.add_indicators()`: Add custom indicators. See https://pastebin.com/1DjWv2Hd for valid indicators.
- `"volume"` indicators included by default.

Fix:
- Update RSI algorithm. This is the third time TradingView changed its algorithm, causing the analysis to be inaccurate.

name: Version 3.2.4
body:
What's new:
- Retrieve multiple analysis (#43) 

Bugfix:
- Update compute algorithms (#45)

name: Version 3.2.3
body:
What's new:
- [Timeout (optional)](https://python-tradingview-ta.readthedocs.io/en/latest/usage.html#setting-the-timeout-optional)
- BBUpper and BBLower indicators
- [Test script](https://github.com/deathlyface/python-tradingview-ta/blob/main/test.py)

Bug fix:
- None

name: Version 3.2.2
body:
What's new:
- Added open and P.SAR indicator. Now you can get a buy/sell/neutral signal from P.SAR, but this won't be added to get_analysis(). Please refer to the documentation https://python-tradingview-ta.readthedocs.io/en/latest/usage.html#p-sar.

name: Version 3.2.1
body:
What's new:
- Removed EMA5 and SMA5 from `analysis.moving_averages` as TradingView does not show them anymore. You can still access EMA5 and SMA5 indicators through `analysis.indicators`.

Fix:
- Switched buy/sell on momentum technical analysis

Tested On:
- `NASDAQ:TSLA` on 1d, 1W, and 1M
- `BINANCE:BTCUSDT` on 1m, 1d, and 1M

name: Version 3.2.0
body:
Simpler TA_Handler instantiating! Now you can write simpler and shorter code with arguments:

```python
from tradingview_ta import TA_Handler, Interval, Exchange

tesla = TA_Handler(
    symbol="TSLA",
    screener="america",
    exchange="NASDAQ",
    interval=Interval.INTERVAL_1_DAY
)
print(tesla.get_analysis().summary)
# Example output: {"RECOMMENDATION": "BUY", "BUY": 8, "NEUTRAL": 6, "SELL": 3}
```

Don't worry though, your older code (>=3.0.0) might still work with this version. Consider rewriting it if you have the time!

name: Version 3.1.6
body: Edit exception and warning. Remove `"Error: "` and `"Warning: "`. Default interval to `"1d"` if the interval is invalid.

name: Version 3.1.5
body:
- Move indicators to Analysis class
- Simplify code using format

New:
Try the demo at https://tradingview.deathlyf.com/.

name: Version 3.1.4
body: Fix minor bug (#19).

name: Version 3.1.3
body:
Added user agent.
`__version__` now accessible.

name: Version 3.1.1
body: Bugfix. https://github.com/deathlyface/python-tradingview-ta/pull/7

name: Version 3.1.0
body:
Added functions to set values.

(BUG FOUND, USE 3.1.1)

name: Version 3.0.0
body:
- Faster
- Replace selenium with requests.
- Indicators
- Docs [(Read The Docs)](https://python-tradingview-ta.readthedocs.io/)

name: Version 2.2.0
body:
What's new:
- Rename "pair" to "symbol" for general usage.
- Now support from python 3.4 
- Added warning
- Updated usage
